results.title: The Flower
results.creator_credit: Don Haldane, Canadian Cancer Society and Westminster Films
results.brief_description: Tells of the historic discovery in 1959 of a drug called VLB (Vincaleukoblastine), which is still one of the most effective means of fighting Hodgkin’s disease, or cancer of the lymph glands.

results.title: The Flow of electricity
results.brief_description: Explains the factors which affect the flow of electricity through a simple electrical circuit, introduces the electron theory, and shows the application of a simple circuit in a home situation. The film is centred around the inquiries of two children whose father explains to them what electricity is, how it flows through a closed circuit, what the function of the switch is, and how electricity used in the home travels over an electrical circuit.

results.title: The Floor is yours (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Richard Need, Management Training Ltd and Richard Need Productions
results.brief_description: A case study which tells the story of a young manager about to give his first business presentation and how he is saved from panic by help from an unexpected source. He discovers that good preparation is more than half the battle in successful communication and learns a tried and tested method that will see him through every kind of public speaking occasion.

results.title: The Flinders: ranges of legend
results.creator_credit: G Shepherd and S A Government Tourist Bureau
results.brief_description: The geological origin and the place of the Flinders Range in Aboriginal mythology. Shows rock paintings and carvings in the Wilpena area, the old mining town of Blinman and the ruins of Kanyaka.

results.title: The Fleeting image
results.creator_credit: Ann Turner and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Pioneers of photography”.
Deals with the work of Edward Muybridge in California and Etienne Jules Marey in Paris who were using photography to analyse human and animal movement in the 1870’s and 80’s. Their work led to the development of the cine-camera.

results.title: The Flame that freezes
results.brief_description: The manufacture of Electrolux absorption-type refrigerators in the company’s Melbourne factory. Compares old methods of food preservation with those using refrigeration principles. Shows the manufacture of the freezing unit and explains how it operates. Diagrams explain the operation of refrigerators using gas, kerosene and electricity. Summarises the uses of refrigeration in medical services in both city and country.

results.title: The Five Chinese brothers
results.creator_credit: Morton Schindel and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: Once upon a time there were five identical Chinese brothers. The first brother could swallow the sea, the second had an iron neck. The third brother could stretch his legs, the fourth could not be burned and the fifth Chinese brother could hold his breath indefinitely. This amusing riddle tells how the five brothers outwit the townspeople and save themselves from a tragic end.

results.title: The Five
results.creator_credit: Joy Batchelor and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films
results.brief_description: An animated health education film for school children designed to create a positive attitude in the minds of young girls aged 8-12 years. it seeks to encourage them to look after their feet, and emphasises the importance of wearing correctly fitted shoes. Animated by Harold Whitaker.
